Auto_modes module

class Auto_modes.WaypointNavigation(current_state: dict)

Bases: object

This Class handles the tracking of the current position, as well as the calculation of the waypoints and the navigation of the drone to follow them.

Parameters:

  • self.position – Position of the drone in the world coordinate system. The origin is where self.__init()__ is called. Positive X-Axis is in forward direction of tello at its boot, positive Y-Axis are to the right

  • self.previous_state – The state of the drone from djitellopy at the previous call of self.update_position()

  • self.search_parameters – Dictionary with “width” and “depth” of the grid made of the waypoints “distance” is the distance between the flight paths of the grid

  • self.control_input_range – Dictionary of max and min absolute values of the control parameters which will be returned. Min needed so tello recognizes the movement

  • self.relative_Waypoints – List of Dictionaries of the relative_waypoints in the coordinate system of the drone

  • self.waypoints – List of Dictionaries of the waypoints in the world coordinate system

  • self.waypoint_index – Indicates which waypoint is the next to be reached in navigate()

  • self.mag_to_waypoint – Distance to next waypoint

calculate_waypoints(search_area_width: int = 10, search_area_depth: int = 10)

This method calculates the waypoints according to the user input or the default values

Parameters:

  • search_area_width – Width of the area to be searched

  • search_area_depth – Depth of the area to be searched

navigate(current_state: dict) → list

This method returns the steering inputs for Tello to follow the waypoints

Parameters:

current_state – Current state of the drone from djitellopy

Returns:

rc_controls which can be sent to Tello

update_position(current_state)

This method updates the position according to the velocities in current_state and previous_state. The units should be cm, but it’s not. Due to accumulation of measurement inaccuracies the precision is quite low

Parameters:

current_state – Current state of the drone from djitellopy

class Auto_modes.YawFollow

Bases: object

This class makes it possible to keep an object which position is known in the center of the frame by rotating Tello along the Yaw-Axis

navigate()

This method returns the appropriate rc_control values to keep the object with the known coordinates in the center of the frame

Parameters:

obj_cords – Dictionary of the x, y coordinates of the object as well as the width and height of the image the object has been identified

Returns:

rc_controls which can be sent to Tello
